author: David Harrison
title: What to Know About New York Fed Pick John Williams’s Views
text:
The Federal Reserve Bank of New York has selected San Francisco Fed President John Williams as its next leader, succeeding William Dudley, who is retiring in June. Mr. Williams has opined on a variety of monetary and regulatory issues during his tenure at the central bank. Here’s what you need to know about his views on several key topics:
On Raising Interest Rates
Mr. Williams has been an advocate for the Fed’s slow and gradual pace of interest-rate increases. In February, he suggested three or four rate increases would be...
